item.title: Sara add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sara add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Sara add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "And in the end it is not the years in your life that count, it's the life in your years." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sara add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sara add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sara add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sara add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest." -- Confucious

item.title: Sara add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
Sara add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sara add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli
